summary: Room rental listing app for bachelor accommodations - users can browse and find available rooms with detailed information
architectural_notes: Room listing application focused on bachelor accommodations
PWA implementation required for installable web app experience

existing_features.title: Create a homepage that displays a grid of all available bachelor room listings with cards showing: room image placeholder, title, monthly rent, location, and a 'View Details' button for each listing

Build a detailed room view page that displays complete information for a selected room including: full description, all amenities as a list, exact location, contact details, monthly rent, room type, and availability status

Implement a form to add new room listings with fields for: room title, monthly rent, location, room type selection, amenities checkboxes (WiFi, AC, attached bathroom, furniture, parking, etc.), contact information, and description

Apply a warm, welcoming visual theme with earthy tones (terracotta, warm beige, soft greens) and comfortable typography that conveys trustworthiness and home-finding optimism, with card-based layouts and generous spacing to make room browsing feel inviting and stress-free

Configure the application as a Progressive Web App (PWA) by adding a web app manifest file with appropriate metadata including app name, description, icons, theme colors, display mode set to 'standalone', and start URL
Implement a service worker for PWA functionality to enable offline capability, caching strategies, and installation prompts
Generate PWA icon assets in multiple sizes (192x192, 512x512) for the room rental application with a home/room themed design
Update the application name throughout the codebase based on user's preference (ask user for the new desired name)
Add image upload functionality to the AddListingPage form that allows users to select and upload multiple room photos (at least 3-5 photos per listing)
Update RoomCard component to display the first uploaded room photo instead of the placeholder image, with fallback to placeholder if no photos exist
Update RoomDetailPage to display all uploaded room photos in a gallery or carousel format with navigation between images
Update the useQueries.ts hooks to handle the new photos field when fetching and submitting room listings

new_feature_requests.summary: Display list of available bachelor rooms with details
Show room details including rent, location, amenities
Create a backend data model for room listings that stores: room title, monthly rent amount, location/address, room type (single/shared), amenities list, contact information, and availability status
Implement backend methods to add new room listings and retrieve all available rooms filtered by availability status
Convert application to PWA (Progressive Web App) with add-to-home-screen capability
Add image upload functionality for room photos
Update the RoomListing type in backend/main.mo to include a photos field that stores an array of image URLs or base64-encoded image data strings
